mains.description: Chicken piccata is a classic Italian dish, always served with a silky pan sauce of white wine, butter, and parsley, plus capers or lemon. In our simple preparation, chicken is first pounded thin, dredged in flour, then pan-seared for a golden and crispy crust. And because this Popular Recipe is all about tradizione, it's finished with two more classic dinner staples: sautéed green beans and roasted potatoes.
mains.name: Chicken Piccata with Roasted Fingerling Potatoes and Green Beans
mains.subtitle: with Roasted Fingerling Potatoes and Green Beans
mains.title: Chicken Piccata
mains.cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking.


Rub a little water on your work surface, under the bottom piece of plastic wrap, to keep it from shifting while you pound the chicken.


Deglazing is a technique in which adding liquid, like wine and lemon juice, to the pan after cooking protein helps loosen any browned bits stuck to the bottom. Scrape them up into your sauce—they are full of flavor.


The chicken might have a slight odor as a natural reaction to its vacuum packing. USDA recommends cooking chicken to 165°F.

steps.title: Prepare ingredients
steps.description: Preheat oven to 425ºF. Rinse all produce. Halve potatoes lengthwise. Trim and discard ends of green beans (try lining up the ends to trim them all at once). Roughly chop parsley leaves, discarding stems. Halve lemon. Pat chicken dry with paper towel and place between 2 large pieces plastic wrap (see recipe tip). Using a meat mallet or heavy pan, pound to .25-inch thickness.

steps.title: Roast potatoes
steps.description: On a baking sheet, toss potatoes with 1 tablespoon olive oil, .25 teaspoon salt, and pepper as desired. Arrange cut-side down in a single layer, spacing apart as much as possible, and roast until browned and crispy, about 20 minutes. (Keeping the cut sides of the potatoes in direct contact with the hot baking sheet ensures they turn crisp and golden brown.)

steps.title: Sauté green beans
steps.description: While potatoes roast, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. When oil is shimmering, add green beans and season with .25 teaspoon salt and pepper as desired. Sauté, stirring, until bright green and tender, 5-7 minutes. Remove pan from heat. Transfer green beans to serving plates. Wipe pan clean for the next step.

steps.title: Cook chicken
steps.description: Place flour on a large plate and season with .5 teaspoon salt and pepper as desired. Season chicken all over with .25 teaspoon salt and pepper. Dredge chicken in flour, shaking off excess. Return pan from green beans to medium-high heat with 1 packet butter and .5 tablespoon olive oil. When butter is foamy, add chicken and sear until crust is golden and chicken is cooked through and no longer pink, 2-4 minutes per side.

steps.title: Make piccata sauce
steps.description: Transfer chicken to a plate, leaving any juices in pan to make sauce. Return pan to medium-high heat with capers, white wine, parsley, and juice of 1 lemon. Cook, scraping up browned bits from bottom of pan, until liquid is reduced by half, 2-3 minutes (see recipe tip). Remove pan from heat and stir in remaining butter to melt. Return chicken to pan and turn to coat. Then, taste piccata sauce and add salt and pepper as desired.

steps.title: Plate chicken piccata
steps.description: Add roasted potatoes and chicken to plates with sautéed green beans. Spoon piccata sauce from pan over chicken. Dig in!

mains.description: We have a soft spot for gyros, so when Chef Giuseppe dreamed up this open-face iteration of the classic Greek street food, we were smitten. Rather than the traditional spit-roasted meat, this Popular Recipe features herb- and spice-infused patties with a (not-so) secret ingredient: sweet pork sausage. Yes, you read that right—and you'll be seriously impressed with the extra burst of flavor. It's all layered onto toasted naan and topped with tangy marinated feta, plus roasted peppers and onions.
mains.name: Pork Gyros with Marinated Feta and Roasted Bell Pepper
mains.subtitle: with Marinated Feta and Roasted Bell Pepper
mains.title: Pork Gyros
mains.cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking.


The skin of the lemon (and other citrus fruits) is home to the highest concentration of aromatic oils, so chefs use zest to add bright, perfumy flavor and a little texture. It's easier and safer to zest the lemon before cutting and juicing. If you prefer less lemon flavor, feel free to skip the zest—your marinated feta will be equally delicious.


USDA recommends cooking pork sausage to 160ºF.

steps.title: Prepare ingredients
steps.description: Preheat oven to 450°F. Rinse all produce. Halve cucumber lengthwise; cut crosswise into .25-inch half-moons. Halve bell pepper lengthwise, discarding seeds and stem; cut lengthwise into .25-inch strips. Roughly chop basil, dill, oregano, and parsley leaves, keeping separate and discarding stems. If you have a zester, rinse lemon and zest up to .5 (see recipe tip), then halve. Mince garlic. Peel onion, halve, and thinly slice.

steps.title: Roast bell pepper and onion
steps.description: On a baking sheet, toss bell pepper and onion with half of parsley, 1 tablespoon olive oil, .25 teaspoon salt, and black pepper as desired. Arrange in a single layer, spacing apart. Roast until vegetables are tender and browned, 10-12 minutes.

steps.title: Form and cook patties
steps.description: While vegetables roast, in a medium bowl, combine garlic, half of oregano, and remaining parsley, then add sausage. Using your hands, mix well, then form into 6 equal patties, about 1-inch thick. Heat 2 teaspoons olive oil in a medium pan over medium-high heat. When oil is shimmering, add patties. Cook until browned and no longer pink, 3-4 minutes per side.

steps.title: Marinate feta
steps.description: While patties cook, place feta in a separate medium bowl, then add dill, lemon zest (if using), juice of .5 lemon (or use less, if desired), remaining oregano, 2 tablespoons olive oil, .5 tablespoon salt, and black pepper as desired. Turn to thoroughly coat, then set aside to marinate until ready to serve.

steps.title: Toast naan and make salad
steps.description: Stack naan breads, wrap in foil, and place in oven to warm through, 5-8 minutes. Meanwhile, pat arugula dry with paper towel and place in a large bowl, then add cucumber and basil. Cut remaining lemon into wedges.

steps.title: Plate pork gyros
steps.description: Transfer 2 tablespoons marinade from bowl with feta to bowl with salad, and toss to coat. Divide toasted naan between serving plates and top with roasted bell pepper and onion, then a handful of salad, then patties. Finish with marinated feta. Serve with remaining salad and lemon wedges for squeezing over, if desired. Opa!

mains.description: Inspired by one of Chef Elana’s favorite pizzas, this Popular Recipe will inspire you to change your relationship status to: engaged to pizza. Aromatic truffle zest and Fontina cheese create an intoxicating aroma and savory flavor. Burrata, a luxuriously creamy mozzarella cheese, is draped over the crispy golden crust. The pizza is finished with nutty pistachios for texture and honey for sweetness. This dinner happily takes your courtship with pizza to the next level and is perfect for sharing.
mains.name: Truffle Pizza with Burrata, Honey, and Pistachios
mains.subtitle: with Burrata, Honey, and Pistachios
mains.title: Truffle Pizza
mains.cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking. Trust us—you'll be glad you did!


Pizza dough softens as it warms—the longer you let it sit at room temperature, the easier it’ll be to roll out. We recommend at least 15 minutes.


Burrata is a very delicate cheese so be sure to handle gently. Since it is filled with a soft cream, discard only the watery liquid from the container and not any cheese solids.


Try lifting the dough with your hands, letting gravity help stretch it down. Using your fingers, gently pull the edges, feeling for thicker areas so the dough doesn’t tear.

steps.title: Prepare ingredients
steps.description: Preheat oven to 425°F. Remove pizza dough from bag and let soften at room temperature (see recipe tip). Rinse mixed lettuces and pat dry with paper towel. Halve lemon. Remove burrata from container, discarding excess liquid, and transfer to a plate (see recipe tip).

steps.title: Roll out dough
steps.description: Sprinkle flour onto a clean, dry surface, coating a rolling pin or your hands with a thin layer. Roll or stretch dough into a rectangular shape, rotating frequently and working from center to edges, until .25-inch thick (see recipe tip).

steps.title: Bake pizza
steps.description: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and rub with 1 teaspoon olive oil. Add pizza dough, gently stretching to reach edges of baking sheet, and drizzle over 2 teaspoons olive oil. Sprinkle over Fontina and .5 packet truffle zest (save remainder for sprinkling over popcorn). Season with .25 teaspoon salt and pepper as desired. Bake until crust is crisp and lightly browned, 15-17 minutes.

steps.title: Make dressing
steps.description: While pizza bakes, in a large bowl, whisk together juice of .5 lemon, 2 tablespoons olive oil, .25 teaspoon salt, and pepper as desired. Set aside until ready to serve. Roughly chop pistachios, or leave in bag and gently crush with the bottom of a heavy pan. Use remaining lemon to brighten a glass of water.

steps.title: Finish pizza
steps.description: Sprinkle pistachios over pizza. Tear burrata into pieces and scatter over top. Drizzle over honey. Return pizza to oven and bake until burrata begins to melt and honey is runny, about 3 minutes.

steps.title: Plate truffle pizza
steps.description: Add mixed lettuces to bowl with dressing and toss to coat. Cut truffle pizza into slices and serve with salad. Dig in!

mains.description: Crispy shrimp tacos without the deep fry? We are so in. In this Popular Recipe back by customer demand, seared shrimp are chopped and folded into a spicy chipotle mayo, and panko breadcrumbs bring instant crunch. A lime-spiked slaw piled on top adds even more incredible texture. Serve with a crisp, smooth Mexican-style lager and you’ll be ready to hit the cabana in no time.
mains.name: Crispy Shrimp Tacos with Cabbage-Carrot Slaw and Chipotle Mayo
mains.subtitle: with Cabbage-Carrot Slaw and Chipotle Mayo
mains.title: Crispy Shrimp Tacos
mains.cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking. Trust us—you'll be glad you did!


Need a trick for mincing garlic? Head to plated.me/chopshop for a how-to video straight from our Test Kitchen.


Panko breadcrumbs can be quick to burn. Keep a close eye on the pan and stir frequently until just golden.


USDA recommends cooking shellfish to 145°F.

steps.title: Prepare ingredients
steps.description: Rinse all produce. Halve lime. Roughly chop cilantro leaves, discarding stems. Trim and discard scallion roots and thinly slice. Mince garlic (see recipe tip). Pat shrimp dry with paper towel and season with .25 teaspoon salt and pepper as desired.

steps.title: Warm tortillas
steps.description: Heat a large nonstick pan over medium-high heat. Carefully hover your hand a few inches away from the pan—when you can easily feel heat, add tortillas in a single layer and toast, working in batches as needed, until warmed through, about 30 seconds per side. Stack tortillas and wrap in foil to keep warm until ready to serve. Reserve pan for the next step.

steps.title: Toast breadcrumbs
steps.description: Heat pan from tortillas over medium heat. Add breadcrumbs and toast, stirring frequently, until golden, 5-6 minutes (see recipe tip). Transfer breadcrumbs to a plate, reserving pan for the next step.

steps.title: Sear shrimp
steps.description: Heat pan from breadcrumbs over medium-high heat and add 1 tablespoon canola oil. When oil is shimmering, add shrimp and cook, stirring occasionally, until opaque and just pink, 4-6 minutes total. Using a slotted spoon, transfer shrimp to cutting board and allow to cool slightly, then roughly chop.

steps.title: Make slaw and shrimp
steps.description: In a large bowl, whisk together sour cream, cilantro, garlic, half of mayonnaise, juice of .5 lime, .25 teaspoon salt, and pepper as desired until fully combined (cut remaining lime into wedges for serving, if desired). Add slaw mix and scallions and toss to coat. In a medium bowl, stir together chipotle paste (skip or use half for less heat) and remaining mayonnaise to combine, then stir in chopped shrimp.

steps.title: Finish shrimp and plate
steps.description: Add toasted breadcrumbs to bowl with shrimp and toss gently to combine, being careful not to overmix (so the breadcrumbs stay crunchy!). Divide tortillas between serving plates and layer with cabbage-carrot slaw and crispy shrimp. Dig in!

mains.description: Since her mother makes this warm and flavorful Popular Recipe for just about every celebratory occasion, Chef Elana affectionately calls it "holiday chicken." It's super easy to make, but also feels really impressive to serve. Perfectly pan-seared chicken breasts are doused in a sauce of orange juice, brown sugar, and white wine, and braised with shallots, apricots, and currants for a sweet and tangy balance. Roasted alongside tender fingerling potatoes, the aroma alone will bring some holiday magic to your kitchen, in any season.
mains.name: Braised Chicken, Apricots, and Currants with Roasted Fingerling Potatoes
mains.subtitle: with Roasted Fingerling Potatoes
mains.title: Braised Chicken, Apricots, and Currants
mains.cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking.


Before preheating, make sure there's enough room in your oven for the medium pan and baking sheet to fit at the same time. Move around racks if needed.


Deglazing is a technique in which adding liquid, like wine and orange juice, to the pan after cooking protein loosens any flavorful browned bits stuck to the bottom. Scrape them up into your sauce.


The chicken might have a slight odor as a natural reaction to its vacuum packing. USDA recommends cooking chicken to 165°F.

steps.title: Prepare ingredients and make sauce
steps.description: Preheat oven to 425ºF (see recipe tip). Rinse all produce. Pat spinach dry with paper towel. Halve potatoes lengthwise. Halve orange. Quarter apricots. Peel shallot and thinly slice into rings. In a medium bowl, whisk together brown sugar, white wine, juice of 1 orange, 1 teaspoon olive oil, .25 teaspoon salt, and pepper as desired to make sauce. Set aside until Step 4.

steps.title: Roast potatoes
steps.description: On a baking sheet, toss potatoes with 1 tablespoon olive oil, .25 teaspoon salt, and pepper as desired, then arrange cut-side down in a single layer, spacing apart as much as possible to help them crisp. Roast until golden and tender, about 18 minutes. Meanwhile, pat chicken dry with paper towel and season all over with .5 teaspoon salt.

steps.title: Sear chicken
steps.description: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a medium high-sided ovenproof pan over medium-high heat. When oil is shimmering, add chicken skin-side down and sear until skin begins to brown, about 5 minutes. Flip and brown on opposite side, about 1 minute more (you're just getting a flavorful sear on the outside here—the chicken will finish cooking in the oven). Transfer chicken to a plate, skin-side up. Reduce heat under pan to medium.

steps.title: Braise chicken
steps.description: Add shallot to pan, still over medium heat, and cook, stirring, to soften, 2 minutes. Remove pan from heat. Add half of sauce, scraping up brown bits from bottom of pan (see recipe tip). Scatter currants and apricots around in pan, then cover with remaining sauce. Return chicken to pan skin-side up, nestling into sauce. Transfer to oven and roast (with potatoes) until chicken is cooked through and no longer pink, 10-12 minutes.

steps.title: Wilt spinach and finish sauce
steps.description: Once potatoes are golden, add spinach and 1 teaspoon olive oil to baking sheet, toss to combine with potatoes, then spread in an even layer. Return to oven and continue roasting until spinach is wilted, 2 minutes more. Once chicken is cooked through, using a slotted spoon or tongs, transfer chicken to serving plates, leaving sauce behind in pan, off heat. Stir in butter to melt until sauce is silky.

steps.title: Plate braised chicken
steps.description: Spoon sauce, currants, and apricots over braised chicken, and serve with roasted potatoes and spinach. Dig in!

mains.description: Some of our most popular meals come from combining our favorite dishes in the Test Kitchen (because sometimes you can't choose and, therefore, must have both). In this Popular Recipe, it's a mashup of pounded and pan-seared chicken paillard plus Caprese salad, the classic Italian trio of tomato, basil, and mozzarella. We're adding even more of an Italian spin by dusting the chicken with Parmesan for a crunchy, salty, perfectly golden crust. You really can have it all...
mains.name: Caprese Chicken over Warm Spinach Salad
mains.subtitle: over Warm Spinach Salad
mains.title: Caprese Chicken
mains.cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking.


Rub a little water on your work surface, under the bottom piece of plastic wrap, to keep it from shifting while you pound the chicken.


Achieve a crispy, golden crust with the right level of heat. If the chicken begins to darken too quickly, add more oil to the pan, 1 tablespoon at a time, as needed.


The chicken might have a slight odor as a natural reaction to its vacuum packing. USDA recommends cooking chicken to 165°F.

steps.title: Prepare ingredients
steps.description: Rinse all produce. Pick basil leaves, discarding stems (this is a great task for a helper). Halve tomatoes. Pat spinach dry with paper towel. Cut mozzarella into .5-inch cubes. Peel shallot, halve, and thinly slice. Pat chicken dry with paper towel and place between 2 large pieces plastic wrap. Using a meat mallet or heavy pan, pound to .25-inch thickness (see recipe tip). Season chicken all over with .25 teaspoon salt and pepper as desired.

steps.title: Dress spinach and tomatoes
steps.description: Heat 1 teaspoon olive oil in a large nonstick pan over medium heat. When oil is shimmering, add shallot. Cook, stirring, until softened, about 3 minutes. Transfer to a large bowl, reserving pan for Step 4. Add Champagne vinegar, mustard, .125 teaspoon salt, and pepper and whisk to combine. Whisking continuously, slowly add 2 tablespoons olive oil to fully combine. Add tomatoes and spinach; toss to coat. Set aside.

steps.title: Dredge chicken
steps.description: Place flour on a large plate and season with .25 teaspoon salt and pepper as desired. In a large shallow bowl, whisk 1 egg. On a separate large plate, combine breadcrumbs and Parmesan. Dredge chicken in flour, shaking off excess. Dip in egg, allowing excess to drip off. Dredge in Parmesan breadcrumbs, pressing to adhere.

steps.title: Cook chicken
steps.description: Wipe pan from shallot clean and place over medium-high heat with 2 tablespoons olive oil. When oil is shimmering, add chicken and sear until crust is browned and chicken is cooked through and no longer pink, 2-4 minutes per side (see recipe tip). Transfer chicken to a paper towel–lined plate to drain.

steps.title: Finish spinach salad
steps.description: Add mozzarella and half of basil to bowl with spinach and tomatoes and toss to combine. Taste and add salt and pepper as desired.

steps.title: Plate Caprese chicken
steps.description: Divide spinach salad between serving plates and top with chicken. Roughly tear remaining basil and sprinkle over everything (or enlist your dinner companion to help with the garnish). Dig in!

mains.description: We’d like to reintroduce you to one of our most epic mashups: classic French onion soup in burger form. In this Popular Recipe, beef burgers are slathered with melty Gruyère cheese and sweet caramelized onion gravy. The burgers are sandwiched between toasted English muffins that have the ideal craggy surface for absorbing the mustard and the gravy. Served with a heap of arugula salad alongside, this powerhouse meal will have you wanting more long after the last bite.
mains.name: French Onion Soup Burgers with Gruyère and Arugula
mains.subtitle: with Gruyère and Arugula
mains.title: French Onion Soup Burgers
mains.cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking. Trust us—you'll be glad you did!


Burger patties tend to puff up when cooked. Creating a shallow dimple in the center of each helps them cook evenly and keep their shape.


The uneven surface of English muffins can cause them to stick to the pan. If you're having trouble with this, grab a separate nonstick pan to toast the buns separately.


USDA recommends cooking ground beef to 160°F.

steps.title: Prepare ingredients
steps.description: Rinse all produce. Pat arugula dry with paper towel. Strip thyme leaves, discarding stems. Halve lemon. Peel onion, halve, and thinly slice. In a large bowl, whisk together juice of .5 lemon (or start with a little, then taste and add more as desired), .5 tablespoon olive oil, and .125 teaspoon salt. Set aside for Step 6. Use remaining lemon to brighten a glass of water.

steps.title: Caramelize onion
steps.description: Heat butter in a medium pan over medium-high heat. When butter is foamy, add thyme and onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until onion is light brown and softened, about 6 minutes. Then, add 1 tablespoon water and reduce heat to medium. Cook, stirring continuously to keep it from sticking, until onion is golden brown and very soft, about 5 minutes more.

steps.title: Form burgers
steps.description: While onion cooks, pat beef dry with paper towel and season with .5 teaspoon salt and pepper as desired. Using your hands, mix well, then form into 2 equal patties, about .5-inch thick. Using your thumb, create a dimple on top of each (see recipe tip). Place burgers on a plate and set aside until Step 5.

steps.title: Make onion gravy
steps.description: Add flour to pan with onion, still over medium heat, and cook, stirring vigorously to prevent burning, until flour is no longer visible, about 2 minutes. Add beef stock and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium high and simmer, stirring occasionally, until gravy is thickened and reduced by .66, 2-3 minutes more. Remove pan from heat. Season with .125 teaspoon salt and pepper as desired.

steps.title: Sear burgers
steps.description: Heat 1 teaspoon olive oil in a separate medium pan over medium heat. When oil is shimmering, add burgers and sear, without flipping, until browned on bottom, about 4 minutes. Flip and continue searing until browned and medium rare, 3-4 minutes. Spoon onion gravy over burgers, then top with Gruyère. Cover pan and cook until cheese is melted, 1-2 minutes more. Transfer burgers to a plate. Wipe pan clean for the next step.

steps.title: Finish and plate burgers
steps.description: Split English muffins open horizontally, then add cut-side down to pan from burgers over medium heat. Toast until light golden, about 2 minutes (see recipe tip). Spread mustard over cut sides of muffins. Layer with French onion soup burgers and any remaining onion gravy. Add arugula to bowl with dressing, toss to coat, and serve with burgers. Dig in!

mains.description: This version of steak and potatoes is extra satisfying and colorful and easy to make—why it’s become a much-loved Popular Recipe. Cherry tomatoes are cooked down with sherry vinegar for a zingy vinaigrette that’s drizzled over perfectly seared steaks. We keep things simple with potatoes and green beans that are cooked until just tender, then tossed with Parmesan and olive oil. Finish with a flourish of flaky Maldon salt, then dive into your masterpiece.
mains.name: Seared Steak with Cherry Tomato Vinaigrette
mains.subtitle: with Cherry Tomato Vinaigrette
mains.title: Seared Steak
mains.cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking. Trust us—you'll be glad you did!


Cutting meat against the grain ensures tenderness. Find the direction of the grain (muscle fibers) and slice across it, rather than parallel.


When using Maldon salt, whose flakes are larger than kosher salt, a little goes a long way. Only use as much as desired!


USDA recommends cooking this steak to 160ºF.

steps.title: Prepare ingredients
steps.description: Rinse all produce. Trim and discard ends of green beans (try lining them up to trim all at once). Cut potatoes into 1-inch cubes, place in a medium pot, and set aside. Roughly chop parsley leaves, discarding stems. Peel shallot and mince.

steps.title: Make tomato vinaigrette
steps.description: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a medium pan over medium heat. When oil is shimmering, add shallot and cook until beginning to soften, about 1 minute. Add cherry tomatoes and cook until soft and beginning to burst, 8-10 minutes. Using a spoon, mash tomatoes to release their juices. Remove pan from heat. Stir in sherry vinegar, 1 tablespoon olive oil, .125 teaspoon kosher salt, and pepper. Set aside until Step 6.

steps.title: Sear steaks
steps.description: Pat steaks dry with paper towel and season all over with .5 teaspoon kosher salt and pepper as desired. Heat .5 tablespoon olive oil in a separate medium pan over medium-high heat. When oil is shimmering, add steaks and sear until browned and medium rare, 4-5 minutes per side. Transfer steaks to a plate and set aside to rest.

steps.title: Boil potatoes and green beans
steps.description: While steaks sear, cover potatoes in pot with cold water by 1 inch and season generously with kosher salt. Bring to a boil over high heat and cook until almost tender, about 8 minutes. Then, add green beans to pot with potatoes. Continue boiling until beans are bright green and potatoes are tender when pierced with a knife tip, about 2 minutes more. Drain and return to pot, off heat.

steps.title: Season vegetables
steps.description: Add 1 tablespoon olive oil to pot with vegetables, still off heat, and gently stir to coat. Add Parmesan and stir to combine. Taste and add kosher salt and pepper as desired.

steps.title: Plate seared steak
steps.description: Cut steaks against the grain into .25-inch slices (see recipe tip) and divide between serving plates. Return pan with tomato vinaigrette to medium heat to warm through, about 1 minute. Stir in parsley, then spoon over steaks. Serve with potatoes and green beans. Garnish with Maldon salt (see recipe tip) and dig in!

mains.description: Salmon and dill are a classic pairing that we enjoy all year long. In this Popular Recipe, we've struck the perfect balance of rich, fatty fish and a bright, creamy sauce made tangy with Dijon mustard. Served with sautéed kale and crispy fingerling potatoes, this dish is one you'll love for its simple techniques, elegant flavors, and impressive presentation.
mains.name: Salmon and Creamy Dill Sauce with Sautéed Kale and Roasted Fingerling Potatoes
mains.subtitle: with Sautéed Kale and Roasted Fingerling Potatoes
mains.title: Salmon and Creamy Dill Sauce
mains.cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking. Trust us—you'll be glad you did!


Arranging your potatoes cut-side down on the baking sheet, and spacing them apart as much as possible, helps them roast and brown evenly. For extra crispy potatoes, bake for 20 minutes (but be sure to keep an eye on them as they roast to prevent burning).


Set aside a pinch of dill for a bright garnish, or use all of it in your sauce.


USDA recommends cooking fish to 145°F.

steps.title: Prepare ingredients
steps.description: Preheat oven to 425ºF. Rinse all produce. Stack kale leaves and thinly slice, discarding long stems. Halve potatoes lengthwise. Halve lemon. Finely chop dill leaves, discarding stems. Mince garlic.

steps.title: Roast potatoes
steps.description: On a baking sheet, toss potatoes with 1 tablespoon olive oil, .25 teaspoon salt, and pepper as desired. Arrange cut-side down in a single layer and roast until golden and tender, about 15 minutes (see recipe tip).

steps.title: Sauté kale
steps.description: While potatoes roast, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. When oil is shimmering, add garlic and sauté, stirring, until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add kale, season with .25 teaspoon salt and pepper as desired, and sauté, stirring occasionally, until wilted, 3-4 minutes more. Transfer to a plate and set aside. Wipe pan clean for the next step.

steps.title: Sear salmon
steps.description: Pat salmon dry with paper towel and season all over with .5 teaspoon salt and pepper. Place pan from kale over medium heat with 2 teaspoons olive oil. When oil is shimmering, add salmon skin-side down. Sear until golden on bottom, 5 minutes. Flip salmon and cover, keeping lid slightly ajar for steam to escape. Continue searing until salmon is cooked through and opaque, 3-5 minutes more. Transfer to serving plates.

steps.title: Make creamy dill sauce
steps.description: While salmon sears, in a medium bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, mustard, juice of 1 lemon, and dill to combine (see recipe tip). Season with .125 teaspoon salt and pepper as desired.

steps.title: Plate salmon
steps.description: Add sautéed kale to baking sheet with roasted potatoes and toss to combine, then add to serving plates with salmon. Spoon creamy dill sauce over everything and dig in!

mains.description: Chef Andrea riffs on some of our favorite kale-and-roasted-vegetable combos in this Popular Recipe, adding colorful, crunchy red cabbage to dinosaur kale and sweet potatoes. Dried cranberries plump up in lemon juice while the vegetables roast—a tangy-sweet garnish that balances the heartier elements in the dish. Toasted walnuts also get gussied up with a brown sugar glaze. Once again balancing sweet with savory, Chef Andrea tosses everything with a rich, nutty tahini and miso dressing.
mains.name: Kale and Sweet Potato Bowls with Glazed Walnuts and Tahini-Miso Dressing
mains.subtitle: with Glazed Walnuts and Tahini-Miso Dressing
mains.title: Kale and Sweet Potato Bowls
mains.cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking. Trust us—you'll be glad you did!


You want the chickpeas to be extra dry before roasting so they crisp rather than steam in the oven.


If you'd like your kale to be more tender, you can also massage the dressed leaves with your hands until softened.


We recommend rinsing the pan from the glazed walnuts ASAP to make cleanup easier. Cooled sugar can be a tough scrub!

steps.title: Prepare ingredients
steps.description: Preheat oven to 425°F. Rinse all produce. Stack kale leaves, trim and discard stems, and thinly slice crosswise. Cut sweet potatoes into .5-inch dice. Halve lemons. Drain chickpeas and rinse, then pat dry with paper towel (see recipe tip). In a small bowl, combine dried cranberries and juice of .5 lemon and set aside until ready to serve.

steps.title: Season sweet potatoes and chickpeas
steps.description: On a baking sheet, toss sweet potatoes with half of spice blend, 1.5 tablespoons olive oil, .25 teaspoon salt, and pepper as desired. Arrange in a single layer, spacing apart. On a separate baking sheet, toss chickpeas with remaining spice blend, 1 tablespoon olive oil, .25 teaspoon salt, and pepper as desired. Arrange in a single layer, spacing apart.

steps.title: Roast sweet potatoes and chickpeas
steps.description: Transfer sweet potatoes and chickpeas to oven and roast together until sweet potatoes are browned and tender, and chickpeas are golden and crisp, 20-22 minutes.

steps.title: Make miso-tahini dressing
steps.description: While sweet potatoes and chickpeas roast, in a large bowl (big enough for the salad), whisk together tahini, miso paste, juice of remaining lemons (or feel free to use less, if desired), .125 teaspoon salt, and pepper to combine. Whisk in 1-2 tablespoons warm water until dressing is smooth and pourable. Add cabbage and kale to bowl and toss to fully coat (see recipe tip). Set aside until ready to serve.

steps.title: Glaze walnuts
steps.description: Heat 1 teaspoon olive oil in a small nonstick pan over medium-high heat. When oil is shimmering, add brown sugar and cook, stirring constantly, until dissolved, 1-2 minutes. Add walnuts to pan and toss to fully coat, about 1 minute. Remove pan from heat and stir in sesame seeds. Transfer glazed walnuts to a plate and set aside to cool (see recipe tip).

steps.title: Plate kale and sweet potato bowl
steps.description: Divide kale and cabbage between serving bowls and top with roasted sweet potatoes, chickpeas, and glazed walnuts. Drain cranberries and sprinkle over bowls. Dig in!

mains.description: Cauliflower rice—a trendy swap for traditional rice—works wonders in this takeout-inspired dish. Here, fine cauliflower crumbles are crisped in sesame oil as a base for stir-fried snow peas, carrots, and cabbage. Add thinly sliced steak and soy-spiked scrambled eggs for a fried “rice” that’s better than delivery.
mains.name: Steak and Cauliflower Fried Rice with Snow Peas and Carrots
mains.subtitle: with Snow Peas and Carrots
mains.title: Steak and Cauliflower Fried Rice
mains.cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking. Trust us—you'll be glad you did!


If you don't have a blender or food processor, finely chop the cauliflower until it resembles coarse breadcrumbs.


Cutting meat against the grain ensures tenderness. Find the direction of the grain (muscle fibers) and slice across it, rather than parallel.


USDA recommends cooking beef to 145°F.

steps.title: Prepare ingredients
steps.description: Rinse all produce. Halve carrots lengthwise, then thinly slice crosswise on a diagonal. Roughly chop peanuts, or leave in bag and gently crush with the bottom of a heavy pan. Trim and discard scallion roots and thinly slice, keeping whites and light greens separate from dark greens. Trim and discard skin of ginger. Combine garlic and ginger on cutting board and mince. In a small bowl, whisk together 2 eggs and soy sauce.

steps.title: Sauté vegetables
steps.description: Heat 1 tablespoon canola oil in a large nonstick pan over medium-high heat. When oil is shimmering, add carrots; sauté until softening, 3-5 minutes. Add ginger and garlic; cook, stirring, until fragrant, 1 minute. Add snow peas and scallion whites and light greens; cook until tender, 2 minutes. Stir in cabbage, .25 teaspoon salt, and pepper. Transfer vegetables to a bowl and reserve pan, off heat.

steps.title: Fry cauliflower rice
steps.description: While vegetables cook, place cauliflower in a blender or food processor and pulse until coarsely ground (see recipe tip). Return pan from vegetables to medium-high heat with sesame oil. When oil is shimmering, add cauliflower to pan. Stir to coat, press in an even layer, and cook, without stirring, until golden, 1-2 minutes. Transfer to bowl with vegetables and set aside. Reserve pan, off heat, for Step 5.

steps.title: Sear steaks
steps.description: Pat steaks dry with paper towel and season all over with .5 teaspoon salt and pepper as desired. Heat .5 tablespoon canola oil in a medium pan over medium-high heat. When oil is shimmering, add steaks and sear until browned and medium rare, 4-6 minutes per side. Transfer steaks to a plate and set aside to rest.

steps.title: Finish cauliflower fried rice
steps.description: Return pan from cauliflower rice to medium-high heat with 1 tablespoon canola oil. When oil is shimmering, add eggs to pan and scramble, stirring constantly, until cooked through, 1-2 minutes. Return vegetables and cauliflower rice to pan with eggs, season with .25 teaspoon salt and pepper as desired, and stir to combine. Remove pan from heat.

steps.title: Plate steak and cauliflower fried rice
steps.description: Once rested, cut steaks against the grain into .25-inch slices (see recipe tip). Divide cauliflower fried rice between serving plates and top with sliced steak. Drizzle over Sriracha (it's spicy, so feel free to use less). Garnish with peanuts and scallion dark greens, and dig in!

mains.description: Your eyes aren’t fooling you… the sweet potatoes in this recipe are actually purple. We use this less-sweet variety to make crispy potato chips for scooping the saucy, cheesy beef, corn, and butternut squash skillet—essentially a deconstructed burrito. Feel free to serve straight from the pan for a fun presentation (and super easy cleanup).
mains.name: Beef and Butternut Skillet with Monterey Jack and Purple Sweet Potato Chips
mains.subtitle: with Monterey Jack and Purple Sweet Potato Chips
mains.title: Beef and Butternut Skillet
mains.cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking. Trust us—you'll be glad you did!


Using a slotted spoon will drain off any excess fat from the beef so it doesn’t end up in the finished dish. Pouring the fat down the drain might damage your pipes—instead, pour it into a heatproof container once it’s cooled slightly, and dispose in the garbage.


USDA recommends cooking ground beef to 160°F.

steps.title: Prepare ingredients
steps.description: Preheat oven to 450ºF. Rinse all produce. Thinly slice purple sweet potato crosswise on a diagonal (this increases surface area for more browning, but feel free to slice as usual). Cut butternut squash cubes to .25-inch pieces, if needed. Trim and discard scallion root and thinly slice crosswise on a diagonal, keeping whites and light greens separate from dark greens. Line a baking sheet with foil.

steps.title: Bake sweet potato chips
steps.description: On prepared baking sheet, toss purple sweet potatoes with 1 tablespoon olive oil, .5 teaspoon salt, and pepper as desired. Arrange in a single layer, spacing apart as much as possible, and bake until browned and crisp, 15-20 minutes. Meanwhile, pat beef dry with paper towel.

steps.title: Cook beef
steps.description: Heat 2 teaspoons olive oil in a large high-sided pan over medium-high heat. When oil is shimmering, add spice mix, scallion whites and light greens, beef, .5 teaspoon salt, and pepper as desired. Cook, breaking up meat, until browned, about 5 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer beef to a bowl and set aside (see recipe tip). Discard almost all fat from pan, leaving a thin layer behind for the next step.

steps.title: Finish beef and squash
steps.description: Return pan from beef to medium-high heat with 2 teaspoons olive oil. When oil is shimmering, add squash and cook, stirring occasionally, until beginning to soften and brown, 6-8 minutes. Add tomato paste and corn and cook, stirring, until combined, 1-2 minutes. Stir in beef and cook until combined, 1-2 minutes more. Remove pan from heat. Stir in Monterey Jack until melted. Season with .25 teaspoon salt.

steps.title: Make cilantro-lime crema
steps.description: While squash cooks, if you have a zester and want to infuse your crema with even more lime flavor, rinse lime and zest up to .5 into a small bowl, then halve. Finely chop cilantro leaves and stems. To bowl with zest, if using, add sour cream, cilantro, juice of .5 lime (or use less, if desired), .25 teaspoon salt, and pepper, and whisk to combine (a friend can do this part). Cut remaining lime into wedges for serving.

steps.title: Plate potato chips and beef
steps.description: Divide purple sweet potato chips between serving bowls and top with beef and butternut squash (a friend can also do this). Alternatively, bring the skillet to the table and serve with potato chips for scooping. Drizzle over cilantro-lime crema and garnish with scallion dark greens. Serve with lime wedges for squeezing over. Dig in!

mains.description: This chicken Caesar packs in all the crisp greens, creamy dressing, and salty Parmesan we love, then adds a bounty of fall produce—plus, it's all ready in 30 minutes. We're swapping out the traditional romaine for kale, then tossing in tender roasted butternut squash and Brussels sprouts. Juicy Gala apple adds a touch of sweetness, and almonds replace the croutons to give this salad satisfying crunch.
mains.name: Fall Chicken Caesar with Butternut Squash, Kale, and Apple
mains.subtitle: with Butternut Squash, Kale, and Apple
mains.title: Fall Chicken Caesar
mains.cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking. Trust us—you'll be glad you did!


Want to get your dinner date involved in the cooking process? Have them whisk the dressing.


Raw kale can be tough, so it requires a bit of TLC. Massaging the leaves helps soften them up—this is another great task for your dinner date.


The chicken might have a slight odor as a natural reaction to its vacuum packing. USDA recommends cooking chicken to 165°F.

steps.title: Cook chicken
steps.description: Preheat oven to 450ºF. Pat chicken dry with paper towel; season all over with .5 teaspoon salt and pepper. Heat 2 teaspoons olive oil in a medium pan over medium-high heat. When oil is shimmering, add chicken skin-side down and sear until skin is golden and easily lifts from pan, 6 minutes. Flip and sear opposite side until cooked through and no longer pink, about 6 minutes more. Transfer chicken to a plate; set aside to rest until Step 6.

steps.title: Roast vegetables
steps.description: While chicken cooks, line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Rinse all produce. Cut butternut squash cubes to .5-inch pieces, if needed. On prepared baking sheet, toss Brussels sprouts and butternut squash with 2 teaspoons olive oil, .25 teaspoon salt, and pepper as desired. Arrange in a single layer; roast until vegetables are tender, 15-18 minutes.

steps.title: Prepare ingredients
steps.description: While vegetables roast, stack kale leaves and thinly slice, discarding long stems. Roughly chop almonds, or leave in bag and gently crush with the bottom of a heavy pan. In a large bowl (big enough for the salad), reserve 1 tablespoon Parmesan for the next step.

steps.title: Make Caesar dressing
steps.description: Halve lemon. Mince garlic and, still on cutting board, sprinkle over .125 teaspoon salt. Using a large knife, carefully scrape over mixture at a 45° angle, pressing down. Repeat until garlic is broken down and a paste forms; add to large bowl with reserved 1 tablespoon Parmesan, along with anchovy paste, mayonnaise, juice of 1 lemon, .25 teaspoon salt, and pepper. Whisk until smooth (see recipe tip).

steps.title: Massage kale
steps.description: Add kale to bowl with Caesar dressing. Using your hands, massage kale with dressing until leaves are fully coated and beginning to soften and darken, 1-2 minutes (see recipe tip).

steps.title: Plate chicken Caesar
steps.description: Slice off rounded sides of apple and thinly slice, discarding core. Cut rested chicken into .25-inch slices. To bowl with kale, add roasted squash and Brussels sprouts, apple, and remaining Parmesan; toss to coat. Divide fall Caesar salad between serving plates and top with sliced chicken. Garnish with almonds. Enjoy!

mains.description: Creamy, luscious risotto is a Test Kitchen favorite in all its forms. Here, we're searing chicken thighs for crispy skin, then finishing them in the oven until golden. Meanwhile, the flavorful pan drippings are used to toast Arborio rice and infuse it with extra richness. White wine, thyme, tender baby kale, and Parmesan round out the risotto; then, everything's drizzled with a thyme-infused red wine reduction and garnished with more Parmesan.
mains.name: Crispy Chicken Thighs with Parmesan Risotto and Red Wine Reduction
mains.subtitle: with Parmesan Risotto and Red Wine Reduction
mains.title: Crispy Chicken Thighs
mains.cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking. Trust us—you'll be glad you did!


You're just getting a flavorful sear here—the chicken will finish cooking in the oven.


The whole thyme sprigs will season the risotto and red wine reduction with aromatic flavor during cooking, but won’t be pleasant to bite into. We recommend discarding them before serving.


The chicken might have a slight odor as a natural reaction to its vacuum packing. USDA recommends cooking chicken to 165°F.

steps.title: Cook chicken thighs
steps.description: Preheat oven to 425°F. Pat chicken dry with paper towel. Heat 2 teaspoons olive oil in a large high-sided pan over medium-high heat. When oil is shimmering, add chicken skin-side down; sear until skin begins to brown, 5 minutes. Flip and brown opposite side, 1 minute more (see recipe tip). Transfer chicken to a foil-lined baking sheet, skin-side up; roast until skin is crisp and chicken is no longer pink, 20-25 minutes. Reserve pan.

steps.title: Prepare ingredients
steps.description: While chicken cooks, rinse all produce. Pat kale dry with paper towel. Peel onion and cut into small dice. Mince garlic. In a medium pot, bring 1.75 cups water to a boil over high heat. Then, remove pot from heat and cover (this will help the water stay warm until Step 4). Set aside.

steps.title: Sauté aromatics
steps.description: Place pan from chicken over medium heat. When fat is shimmering, add onion and garlic; sauté, stirring, until softened, 3-5 minutes. Add rice and half of whole thyme sprigs; cook, stirring frequently, until rice is toasted and translucent, 2-3 minutes. Increase heat to medium high and add white wine; simmer until liquid is mostly absorbed, 1-2 minutes.

steps.title: Finish Parmesan risotto
steps.description: Add warmed 1.75 cups water to pan with rice, reserving pot for the next step. Increase heat under pan to high and bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium high and simmer, stirring occasionally, until liquid is mostly absorbed and rice is tender, 15-20 minutes. Remove pan from heat. Remove and discard thyme sprigs, then add kale, half of Parmesan, .5 teaspoon salt, and pepper; stir to combine.

steps.title: Make red wine reduction
steps.description: While risotto simmers, to pot from water, add red wine, honey, and remaining whole thyme sprigs and place over high heat. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium and cook, stirring occasionally, until liquid is syrupy and reduced by half, 5-7 minutes. Remove and discard thyme sprigs from pot (see recipe tip).

steps.title: Plate chicken and risotto
steps.description: Divide Parmesan risotto between serving plates. Top with crispy chicken thighs. Drizzle over red wine reduction and garnish with remaining Parmesan. Dig in!

mains.description: Tonight's flavorful chicken buns are inspired by the rich flavors of Peking duck sauce. Tender shredded chicken and Brussels sprouts are tossed in soy sauce and hoisin to create the hearty, sweet, and savory filling. It's stuffed into steamed buns with a crunchy-tangy cabbage and cucumber slaw, then served with creamy hoisin mayo for dipping or drizzling.
mains.name: Hoisin Chicken Buns with Brussels Sprouts and Crunchy Slaw
mains.subtitle: with Brussels Sprouts and Crunchy Slaw
mains.title: Hoisin Chicken Buns
mains.cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking. Trust us—you'll be glad you did!


The stems of cilantro are actually quite tender, so we've kept them for extra flavor and aroma. Chop as finely as possible for the best texture.


The chicken might have a slight odor as a natural reaction to its vacuum packing. USDA recommends cooking chicken to 165°F.

steps.title: Prepare Ingredients
steps.description: Preheat oven to 450°F. Rinse all produce. Halve cucumber lengthwise, cut crosswise into .25-inch half-moons, and place in a medium bowl. Finely chop cilantro leaves and stems (see recipe tip). Trim and discard scallion roots and thinly slice on a diagonal, keeping whites and light greens separate from dark greens. Divide steamed buns evenly between 2 large pieces of foil and loosely wrap.

steps.title: Make crunchy slaw
steps.description: To bowl with cucumber, add cabbage, rice wine vinegar, agave, half of cilantro, scallion whites and light greens, .25 teaspoon salt, and pepper as desired. Toss to coat; set aside to pickle until Step 6. Pat chicken dry with paper towel and season all over with .5 teaspoon salt and pepper.

steps.title: Cook chicken and sprouts
steps.description: Heat 2 teaspoons olive oil in a medium pan over medium-high heat. When oil is shimmering, add chicken; sear until golden, 6 minutes. Flip chicken; scatter around Brussels sprouts in pan. Continue cooking until chicken is cooked through and no longer pink, and Brussels sprouts are softened, 6 minutes more. Transfer chicken to a plate and set aside, reserving Brussels sprouts in pan, off heat.

steps.title: Make sauce and hoisin mayo
steps.description: While chicken and Brussels sprouts cook, place buns in oven to warm through, about 10 minutes. Then, carefully open foil to allow steam to escape. Meanwhile, in a separate medium bowl, whisk together soy sauce and 1 tablespoon hoisin for the next step. In a small bowl, whisk together mayonnaise and remaining hoisin for serving.

steps.title: Finish hoisin chicken
steps.description: Using 2 forks, shred chicken or roughly chop. Return chicken to pan with Brussels sprouts, still off heat. Add hoisin-soy sauce to pan and toss to coat.

steps.title: Plate chicken buns
steps.description: Drain slaw, discarding pickling liquid. Transfer warmed buns to serving plates and stuff with hoisin chicken and Brussels sprouts, crunchy slaw, remaining cilantro, and scallion dark greens. Serve with hoisin mayo for dipping or drizzling. Enjoy!

mains.description: Chef Liz riffs on our creamy coconut curry with this flavorful salmon version. Salmon fillets are rubbed with cumin and turmeric, then roasted alongside cauliflower and carrots until the fish is tender and the vegetables are golden. The vegetables are stirred into a coconut milk and vindaloo curry that's served over fragrant, ginger-infused rice, while the salmon is flaked over top for elegant presentation.
mains.name: Salmon Coconut Curry with Roasted Cauliflower and Carrots
mains.subtitle: with Roasted Cauliflower and Carrots
mains.title: Salmon Coconut Curry
mains.cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking.


Halving the ginger knob increases its surface area, helping it to really infuse the rice with aromatic flavor.


Coconut milk solids naturally separate from the liquids during transit, but come together during cooking. Vigorously shake the can before opening, or pierce the solids with a spoon before pouring into the pan to avoid a messy splatter.


USDA recommends cooking fish to 145°F.

steps.title: Cook ginger rice
steps.description: Preheat oven to 425ºF. Trim and discard skin of ginger, then halve (see recipe tip). In a small pot, combine rice, ginger pieces, .75 cup water, and .25 teaspoon salt, and bring to a boil over high heat. Stir once, reduce heat to medium low, cover pot, and simmer until water is fully absorbed, 10-12 minutes. Remove pot from heat and let stand, still covered, for 10 minutes. Fluff rice with a fork, then cover again to keep warm.

steps.title: Prepare cauliflower and carrots
steps.description: While rice cooks, rinse all produce. Cut cauliflower into 1 inch–wide florets, if needed. Halve carrots lengthwise, then cut crosswise on a diagonal into .25-inch slices (this increases surface area, and creates a nice presentation). Line a baking sheet with foil, then add cauliflower and carrots and toss with 1 tablespoon olive oil, .5 teaspoon salt, and pepper as desired. Arrange in a single layer on 1 half of prepared baking sheet.

steps.title: Roast salmon and vegetables
steps.description: Pat salmon dry with paper towel. On other half of prepared baking sheet, arrange salmon skin-side down. Season tops of fish with spice mix, .5 teaspoon salt, and pepper as desired, then drizzle over 1 teaspoon olive oil and rub in seasoning. Roast until salmon is cooked through and opaque, and vegetables are tender and lightly golden, 12-14 minutes.

steps.title: Sauté aromatics
steps.description: While salmon and vegetables roast, pick cilantro leaves; roughly chop stems, keeping separate. Peel onion, halve, and thinly slice. Using the flat side of a knife, gently crush garlic cloves. In a large high-sided pan, heat 2 teaspoons olive oil over medium-high heat. When oil is shimmering, add onion, crushed garlic, and cilantro stems; sauté, stirring, until softened, 5 minutes. Add curry paste, .25 teaspoon salt, and pepper; sauté until fragrant, 2 minutes more.

steps.title: Finish coconut curry
steps.description: Open coconut milk (see recipe tip) and add to pan with aromatics, still over medium-high heat. Stir to combine, then bring to a simmer and cook until liquid is slightly reduced, 3-4 minutes. Stir in roasted cauliflower and carrots and cook until flavors have melded, 1 minute more. Remove pan from heat. Season with .5 teaspoon salt and pepper as desired.

steps.title: Plate salmon coconut curry
steps.description: Remove and discard ginger pieces from pot with rice, then add spinach and stir to combine. Divide ginger rice between serving bowls. Remove and discard crushed garlic from pan with curry, then spoon coconut curry over rice. Remove and discard skin from salmon; using a fork, flake into large pieces over serving bowls. Garnish with cilantro leaves and dig in!

mains.description: Platers love when our chefs pair rich, super-savory meats with a silky, fruity sauce for sweet contrast. Here, that means sautéed pears and some apricot preserves stirred in with the flavorful pan drippings from pan-roasted pork chops. It's all served over red-skinned potatoes mashed with tangy blue cheese, then garnished with fresh and fragrant tarragon.
mains.name: Pan-Roasted Pork Chop with Apricot-Sherry Jus and Blue Cheese Mashed Potatoes
mains.subtitle: with Apricot-Sherry Jus and Blue Cheese Mashed Potatoes
mains.title: Pan-Roasted Pork Chop
mains.cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking.


Covering the cooked potatoes traps heat, melting the butter and cheese for easier mashing in Step 5.


After cooking protein, adding liquid like wine will deglaze the pan, loosening any flavorful browned bits stuck to the bottom.


Use the remaining stock and apricot preserves to remake this same sauce recipe—it'd be just as great with chicken as it is with pork.


USDA recommends cooking pork to 145°F.

steps.title: Sear pork chops
steps.description: Pat pork chops dry with paper towel and season all over with .5 teaspoon salt and pepper as desired. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a medium high-sided pan over medium-high heat. When oil is shimmering, add pork and sear until browned and cooked through, 3-5 minutes per side. Transfer pork chops to a plate and cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Reserve juices in pan, off heat, for Step 4.

steps.title: Boil potatoes
steps.description: While pork chops sear, rinse all produce. Halve potatoes, place in a medium pot, and cover with cold water by 1 inch. Season generously with salt and bring to a boil over high heat. Cook until tender when pierced with a knife tip, 8-10 minutes (move on to Step 3—but don't forget to come back!). Then, drain potatoes and return to pot, off heat. Add blue cheese and 1 packet butter, then cover to keep warm until Step 5 (see recipe tip).

steps.title: Prepare ingredients
steps.description: While potatoes boil, slice off rounded sides of pear, discarding core, and cut into .25-inch slices. Thinly slice carrots crosswise on a diagonal (this technique, known as the bias cut, increases surface area for even cooking). Roughly chop tarragon leaves, discarding stems. Peel onion, quarter, and separate layers.

steps.title: Sauté carrots and pear
steps.description: Return pan from pork to medium-high heat with remaining butter. When butter is foamy, add carrots and onion and sauté, stirring, until beginning to soften, 3 minutes. Add pear and cook, stirring, until beginning to caramelize, 2-3 minutes. Add sherry and cook, scraping up any brown bits from bottom of pan, until slightly reduced, 2 minutes more (see recipe tip). Season with .25 teaspoon salt and pepper as desired.

steps.title: Simmer jus and mash potatoes
steps.description: Add half of vegetable stock and half of apricot preserves to pan with carrots and pear (see recipe tip). Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium high and simmer until liquid is reduced by half, 5-6 minutes more. Meanwhile, using a large fork or potato masher, mash potatoes with butter and blue cheese until mostly smooth. Taste and add salt and pepper as desired.

steps.title: Plate pork chop
steps.description: Cut pork chops into .25-inch slices. Divide blue cheese mashed potatoes between serving plates. Using a slotted spoon, transfer carrots and pear to serving plates, leaving apricot-sherry jus behind in pan. Then, top vegetables with pork, spoon over jus, and garnish with tarragon. Enjoy!

mains.description: Chef Giuseppe’s “throwing out the rulebook” when it comes to calamari, trying something “unexpected, but very old-school.” He’s referring to the French court bouillon, or short broth, most often used to poach fish or seafood. Ours is simple: water with a splash of white wine vinegar, salt, and herb stems to gently infuse the calamari before they're served over buttery, Parmesan-laced fregola pasta.
mains.name: Herb-Poached Calamari with Fregola and Caramelized Fennel
mains.subtitle: with Fregola and Caramelized Fennel
mains.title: Herb-Poached Calamari
mains.cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking. Trust us—you'll be glad you did!


Warming the broth first ensures that your fregola cooks quickly and evenly in Step 3 (adding cold liquid would slow down the cooking process).


The court bouillon (water, vinegar, herb stems) quickly cooks and infuses the calamari—we use a bit more salt than you might expect, just like you would when boiling pasta, for maximum flavor. USDA recommends cooking shellfish to 145°F.

steps.title: Prepare ingredients
steps.description: In a medium pot, combine vegetable bouillon cube and 2 cups water and bring to a boil over high heat; remove from heat and cover to keep warm (see recipe tip). Roughly chop parsley and thyme leaves, keeping separate; reserve stems for Step 5. Halve fennel bulb, then cut core out in a wedge shape and discard; slice as thinly as possible. Pat spinach dry with paper towel and roughly chop. Peel onion and cut into small dice.

steps.title: Toast fregola
steps.description: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a separate medium pot over medium heat. When oil is shimmering, add onion and sauté, stirring, until softening, 3-5 minutes. Add fregola and cook, stirring frequently, until toasted, 2-3 minutes. Add white wine (not the vinegar) and simmer until liquid is mostly absorbed, 1-2 minutes more.

steps.title: Cook fregola
steps.description: Add warmed vegetable broth to pot with fregola (reserve pot from broth for the next step). Increase heat under fregola to high and bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium high and simmer, stirring occasionally, until liquid is mostly absorbed and fregola is tender, 13-17 minutes.

steps.title: Caramelize fennel
steps.description: While fregola simmers, fill pot from broth with water and bring to a boil over high heat for the next step. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. When oil is shimmering, add fennel and half of thyme and sauté, stirring occasionally, until softened and golden brown, 8-10 minutes. Meanwhile, pat calamari dry with paper towel.

steps.title: Poach calamari
steps.description: To pot with boiling water, add white wine vinegar, herb stems, and 1 tablespoon salt (see recipe tip). Simmer until flavors have melded, about 2 minutes. Then, add calamari and simmer until cooked through and tender, about 2 minutes. Drain calamari, discarding aromatics (you can also use a slotted spoon to transfer calamari to a plate). Once caramelized, season fennel with .25 teaspoon salt and pepper.

steps.title: Plate calamari
steps.description: Once cooked, remove pot with fregola from heat, and season with .5 teaspoon salt and pepper as desired. Stir in Parmesan, butter, herb-poached calamari, spinach, remaining thyme, half of parsley, and half of caramelized fennel to combine. Divide between serving plates. Top with remaining fennel, and garnish with remaining parsley. Enjoy!

mains.description: Chef Shanna shares one of her favorite cold weather comforts: a hearty vegetable minestrone. In this version, butternut squash, white beans, and short, hollow ditalini noodles simmer in a fragrant broth until tender. It’s shot through with pesto for an herby hit, then finished with Parmesan.
mains.name: Pesto Minestrone with Ditalini and White Beans
mains.subtitle: with Ditalini and White Beans
mains.title: Pesto Minestrone
mains.cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking. Trust us—you'll be glad you did!


We recommend a 10-15 minute simmer so the soup can thicken and the flavors can meld. If pressed for time, you can simmer for 5-10 minutes (the soup will still taste delicious).


Mashing half of the beans releases their starches to help thicken the broth. Leave the other half whole to add texture to the soup.

steps.title: Prepare ingredients
steps.description: Rinse all produce. Quarter carrots lengthwise, then cut crosswise into .25-inch pieces. Cut butternut squash cubes to .25-inch pieces, if needed. Peel onion and cut into small dice. Mince garlic.

steps.title: Sauté vegetables
steps.description: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. When oil is shimmering, add carrots, butternut squash, and onion and sauté, stirring occasionally, until softening, about 5 minutes. Add spice mix and garlic and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 1 minute more. Season with .25 teaspoon salt and pepper as desired.

steps.title: Simmer soup
steps.description: To pot with vegetables, still over medium-high heat, add tomatoes and their juices, bouillon cube, 3 cups water, .5 teaspoon salt, and pepper as desired. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium and simmer until vegetables are tender and flavors have melded, 10-15 minutes (see recipe tip).

steps.title: Mash beans and make dressing
steps.description: While soup simmers, drain and rinse white beans and place in a small bowl. Using a fork or potato masher, mash half of beans, leaving remainder whole (see recipe tip). In a separate small bowl, whisk together half of pesto and 1 tablespoon olive oil to combine (reserve remaining pesto for the next step). Set pesto dressing aside for serving.

steps.title: Cook pasta and finish soup
steps.description: To pot with soup, still over medium-high heat, add ditalini and mashed and whole white beans and cook until pasta is al dente, about 7 minutes. Remove pot from heat. Pat spinach dry with paper towel and stir into pot with soup to wilt. Stir in remaining pesto. Taste and season with salt and pepper as desired.

steps.title: Plate pesto minestrone
steps.description: Divide pesto minestrone between serving bowls. Garnish with pesto dressing and Parmesan. Enjoy!

mains.description: Fall makes us absolutely giddy for golden winter squash, especially delicata—a thin-skinned variety at its peak right now. While the squash roasts, we dress up quinoa with a bright kale and basil pesto, then stir in tart, chewy dried cranberries for color and texture. It all comes together in one incredibly colorful, veggie-packed bowl.
mains.name: Delicata Squash and Quinoa Bowls with Kale Pesto and Crispy White Beans
mains.subtitle: with Kale Pesto and Crispy White Beans
mains.title: Delicata Squash and Quinoa Bowls
mains.cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking. Trust us—you'll be glad you did!


What to do with the remaining white beans? Stir into a soup, sprinkle over a salad, or mash into a spread for toast.


If you don't have a blender or food processor, finely chop basil, garlic, and kale, then place in a bowl with remaining pesto ingredients and stir to combine. The texture won't be as smooth, but it will still be delicious.

steps.title: Cook quinoa
steps.description: Preheat oven to 450°F. In a small pot, combine quinoa, 1 cup water, and .25 teaspoon salt. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium low, cover pot, and simmer until water is absorbed and quinoa is tender, about 15 minutes. Remove pot from heat and cover to keep warm until Step 5. Meanwhile, rinse all produce. Pat baby kale dry with paper towel.

steps.title: Roast delicata squash
steps.description: Halve delicata squash lengthwise, then scoop out and discard seeds (your dining companion can do this part). Cut crosswise into .5-inch slices, discarding ends. On a baking sheet, toss squash with 1 tablespoon olive oil, .5 teaspoon salt, and pepper as desired. Arrange in a single layer; roast until softened, 10 minutes. Meanwhile, drain and rinse white beans. Measure out 1 cup (see recipe tip), and pat dry with paper towel for the next step.

steps.title: Roast white beans
steps.description: In a small bowl, toss together white beans, 2 teaspoons olive oil, and .25 teaspoon salt. After 10 minutes of squash roasting, push squash to 1 half of baking sheet. Add white beans to other half of sheet. Arrange in a single layer. Continue roasting until squash is tender and white beans are crispy, 12-15 minutes more. Then, drizzle .5 packet honey over squash and beans; reserve remainder for salad dressing.

steps.title: Make kale pesto
steps.description: While squash and beans roast, pick basil leaves, discarding stems. Halve lemon. In a blender or food processor, combine whole garlic clove, basil, 1 cup baby kale, and 3 tablespoons olive oil, and pulse until almost smooth (see recipe tip). Stir in half of Parmesan, juice of .5 lemon, .5 teaspoon salt, and pepper as desired.

steps.title: Finish quinoa and dress kale
steps.description: To pot with quinoa, add cranberries and half of kale pesto and stir to combine—another great task for your dining companion. In a large bowl, whisk together remaining honey, juice of remaining lemon, 1 tablespoon olive oil, .125 teaspoon salt, and pepper as desired. Add remaining baby kale to bowl with dressing and toss to coat.

steps.title: Plate squash and quinoa bowls
steps.description: Divide pesto quinoa between serving bowls and top with roasted delicata squash, crispy white beans, and kale salad. Dollop over remaining kale pesto and garnish with remaining Parmesan. Dig in!

desserts.description: The hasselback technique, or thinly slicing just the top part of a fruit or vegetable, creates a pretty accordion effect in these baked apples. The fanned layers are slathered with brown sugar, butter, and cinnamon, then topped with a toasted pecan streusel for crunch. Finish with a dollop of honey-sweetened mascarpone for a dessert with major wow factor.
desserts.name: Hasselback Apples with Pecan Streusel and Whipped Mascarpone
desserts.subtitle: with Pecan Streusel and Whipped Mascarpone
desserts.title: Hasselback Apples
desserts.cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking.


No microwave? No problem! In a small pot, melt butter over medium heat, then pour into a large heatproof bowl.


To remove the core from each apple half, arrange cut-side up, then cut a shallow "V" around the core, being careful not to slice all the way through.


Try placing a pair of chopsticks or wooden spoons on either side of each apple half to stop your knife from slicing through them. If you do, no worries: the finished apples will look and taste like a classic crisp.


Don't worry if some of the pecan streusel doesn't stay on the apples; it will toast in the tin and be sprinkled on top in Step 6.

steps.title: Prepare ingredients
steps.description: Preheat oven to 450°F. Unwrap 2 packets butter and place in a large heatproof bowl. Microwave in 30-second intervals until completely melted (see recipe tip). To bowl with melted butter, add 1 tablespoon brown sugar and .5 teaspoon cinnamon (reserve remainder for streusel) and whisk to combine. Rinse apples; peel, halve lengthwise, and remove and discard cores (see recipe tip).

steps.title: Slice and bake apples
steps.description: Arrange apples cut-side down on cutting board. Working from left to right, thinly slice about .75 of the way through each apple half, without slicing all the way through (see recipe tip). Reshape aluminum tin, if bent, then add apples, cut-side down. Rub apples all over with butter and brown sugar mixture, reserving bowl for the next step. Cover tin with foil and bake until apples are softened, 20 minutes.

steps.title: Make pecan streusel
steps.description: While apples bake, in bowl from butter mixture, stir together pecans, flour, remaining brown sugar, remaining cinnamon, and .125 teaspoon salt. Add remaining butter and, using your hands or a fork, work butter into pecan mixture to combine into a crumbly texture—the butter pieces should be pea-sized.

steps.title: Finish hasselback apples
steps.description: After 20 minutes of apples baking, remove from oven and carefully remove and discard foil. Top apples with pecan streusel, lightly pressing to adhere (see recipe tip). Return tin to oven, uncovered, and continue baking until streusel is golden, 10 minutes more. Wipe bowl clean for the next step.

steps.title: Whip mascarpone
steps.description: While apples and streusel bake, in bowl from streusel, whisk together mascarpone and honey until well combined. Finely chop sage leaves, discarding stems. Use the remaining downtime to relax and enjoy the sweet smells filling your kitchen.

steps.title: Plate hasselback apples
steps.description: Once baked, let hasselback apples cool 5 minutes, then divide among serving plates. Sprinkle over any remaining pecan streusel from tin. Serve with whipped mascarpone. Garnish with sage and dig in!

desserts.description: If you love pumpkin pie, you'll adore this miniature, handheld version. To create the filling, pumpkin purée is blended with vanilla extract, brown sugar, and our favorite pie spices: cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, and allspice. It's wrapped in puff pastry and baked until golden and flaky outside and gooey inside. On top, a drizzle of homemade maple glaze makes the perfect finishing touch.
desserts.name: Pumpkin Hand Pies with Maple Glaze
desserts.subtitle: with Maple Glaze
desserts.title: Pumpkin Hand Pies
desserts.cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking. Trust us—you'll be glad you did!


It might seem daunting to divide the beaten egg in half, but don't worry if you add a tiny bit more or less. Save yourself the headache and eyeball it!


Save remaining maple syrup for another recipe—we love it drizzled over oatmeal for breakfast.

steps.title: Prepare ingredients
steps.description: Preheat oven to 425°F. Separate puff pastry squares and set aside to soften at room temperature. In a small bowl, whisk 1 egg. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper for Step 3.

steps.title: Make pumpkin filling
steps.description: In a medium bowl, stir together pumpkin purée, pumpkin pie spice, vanilla extract, brown sugar, half of egg (see recipe tip), and .25 teaspoon salt until thoroughly combined. Reserve remaining egg.

steps.title: Assemble hand pies
steps.description: Arrange puff pastry squares in a single layer on prepared baking sheet, spacing apart. Using your hands, gently stretch or press puff pastry squares on sheet into slightly larger squares, about 6 x 6 inches each. Add pumpkin filling to centers of squares, leaving a 1-inch border. Lightly brush borders of pastry with some reserved egg (save remainder for the next step).

steps.title: Bake hand pies
steps.description: Gently fold 1 corner of each puff pastry square over filling to form a triangle, then press edges with your fingers to seal—this is a great task for a kitchen helper. Cut a .5-inch slit on top of each hand pie so steam can escape, then brush over remaining egg. Bake until hand pies are puffed and golden brown, 14-16 minutes.

steps.title: Make maple glaze
steps.description: While hand pies bake, in a separate medium bowl, combine powdered sugar, sour cream, 1 tablespoon maple syrup (see recipe tip), and .125 teaspoon salt and whisk until mixture is smooth and pourable.

steps.title: Finish and plate hand pies
steps.description: Let pumpkin hand pies cool for 5-10 minutes, then drizzle over maple glaze. Dig in!
